pages.text: Skeemella is a genus of Vetulicolian, and although Skeemella currently resides as a Vetulicolian and shares traits with them, it simultaneously possesses traits of both chordates and arthropods, such as the arthropod-like segmentation on its tail. This suggests several things, such as Skeemella either not being a vetulicolian, Vetulicolians in general not being chordates, or possibly a simple case of convergent evolution.
